parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "BeeGenN",
  "details": {
    "resource_requirements": {
      "nodes": 1,
      "cpus": 2,
      "mpi_processes": 10,
      "memory": "64GB",
      "walltime": "07:59:00",
      "queue": "short_gpuQ"
    },
    "software_dependencies": [
      "cuda-11.1",
      "singularity-3.4.0",
      "squashfs-tools"
    ],
    "docker_image": "docker://giacthephantom/beegenn:sleep",
    "python_module": "beegenn.plots.spikes"
  }
}
```

This script uses the **BeeGenN** application, a neural network simulation tool, to generate and analyze spike data. It utilizes a Docker container image (`docker://giacthephantom/beegenn:sleep`) for execution. The script runs on a single node with 2 CPUs, 10 MPI processes, and 64GB of memory. It also requires the CUDA toolkit (version 11.1) and Singularity (version 3.4.0) for container management. 

The script requires `squashfs-tools` (installed from source) for creating and manipulating SquashFS files, which are used by Singularity for image building and deployment. The script uses the `python3 -m beegenn.plots.spikes` command to generate spike plots from the simulated data.
